course_name: Social Work Practice With People Who Have Mental Health Problems
description:
This course provides an intensive focus on four themes which pose long-standing challenges to social work in mental health. Students are encouraged to engage directly with current theoretical literature and research, demonstrating the ability to apply these to direct practice situations. Themes covered:
Mental illness and spirituality
Critiquing recovery
Responding to trauma
Mental illness and welfare
restricted: Restricted to students in the Master of Social Work and Graduate Certificate in Social Work (Mental Health)
